wikipedia_page.main: Sir Alfred Englefield Evans  (30 January 1884 – 29 December 1944) was an English Royal Navy officer and first-class cricketer. Evans was a right-handed batsman who bowled right-arm medium pace. He rose to the rank of vice-admiral during his career, which involved service in the First World War.
